colspan="7" style="align: center;" |Tanks |- valign="top" |Leopard 2||150px150x150px150x150px ||| Main battle tank || Leopard 2A4 \----Leopard 2A5 \----Leopard-NJ \----Leopard 2PL || 133 \----105 \----2 \----9 || All Leopard 2A4s from the first (128) and the second (14) batches are going to be upgraded to Leopard 2PL standard. |- valign="top" |PT-91 "Twardy"||150px|||| Main battle tank || PT-91 \----PT-91MA \----PT-91MA1 || 92 \----27 \----113 || PT-91 - originally produced PT-91. There some mighty plans about modernization all of PT-91s to PT-91M2 standard. |- valign="top" |T-72||150px|| || Main battle tank || T-72 \----T-72A \----T-72M1 \----T-72M1R \----T-72M1D \----SJ-09 || 382 || 318 to be refurbished and modified to T-72M1R standard. Currently 54 T-72M1 are modified to T-72M1R. |- ! colspan="7" style="align: center;" |Infantry fighting vehicle |- valign="top" |BWP-1||150px 150px|| || Amphibious Tracked Infantry Fighting Vehicle || BWP-1 \----BWP-1D || 1,131 \----33 || BWP-1 - Polish designation for BMP-1. To be replaced by new tracked infantry vehicle. |- valign="top" |KBWP Rosomak||150px|| || Amphibious Wheeled Infantry Fighting Vehicle || Rosomak ||726|| Rosomak - wheeled infantry fighting vehicle equipped with HITFIST-30P turret. |- ! colspan="7" style="align: center;" |Armoured personnel carrier |- valign="top" |KTO Rosomak "Wolverine"||150px 150px|| || Amphibious Wheeled Armoured Personnel Carrier || Rosomak-M3 \----Rosomak-S \----Rosomak-NJ ||31 \----27 \----4 ||Rosomak-M3 - armoured personnel carrier, armed with .50 BMG WKM-B or Mk 19 + PKM or UKM-2000 as secondary weapon. Rosomak-S - armoured personnel carrier carries full squad with two Spike-LR ATGM. Rosomak-NJ - vehicle for driver training. |- valign="top" |MT-LB||150px|| || Multi-purpose amphibious tracked armoured personnel carrier || MT-LB L \----MT-LB Z \----MT-LB R \----WD krel || 41 \----6 \----6 \----2 || The MT-LB L vehicles are used for driver training. Some Hibneryts are going to be modernized to newer versions like Hibneryt-P or Hibneryt-3. |- ! colspan="7" style="align: center;" |Anti- aircraft missiles |- valign="top" |Poprad||150px|||| Self-Propelled Surface- to-Air Missile System ||Zubr P|| 44|| 79 POPRAD ordered |- valign="top" |2K12 Kub||150px|||| Self-Propelled Surface-to-Air Missile System || 2K12M Kub-M || 30|| 30 is a number of TELs. |- valign="top" |9K33 Osa||150px|| || Self-Propelled Surface-to-Air Missile System || 9K33M2 Osa-AK 9K33M2 Osa- AKM 9K33M2 Osa-P | 64|| 64 TELARs form 16 batteries. |} ==Aircraft== {| class="wikitable" |- !Model !Image !Origin !Type !Variant !Number !Details |- ! colspan="7" |Helicopters |- | Mil Mi-24 || 150px || || Attack helicopter || Mi-24W Mi-24D || 28 || Two attack squadrons with 12 helicopters, 4 Mi-24W used by SOS. Some are equipped with the Terma A/S MASE (Modular Aircraft Survivability Equipment). 4 Mi-24W lost in Afghanistan. |- | Mil Mi-8 || 150px || || Tactical transport helicopter || Mi-8T || ~10Mil Mi-8 i Mi-17 w Wojsku Polskim. || |- | Mil Mi-17 || 150px || || Tactical transport helicopter || Mi-17 Mi-17-1V Mi-17AE || 4 12 2 || One squadron with 16 helicopters. Some with the Terma A/S MASE. One medical evacuation squadron with 4 helicopters (2 W-3PL and 2 Mi-17AE). |- | PZL W-3 || 150px 150px 150px || || Tactical transport helicopter || W-3W Sokół W-3WA Sokół W-3PL Głuszec W-3WA AE Sokół W-3RR Procjon W-3PSOT || 10 13 7 2 3 1 Total: 36 || |- | PZL Mi-2 || 150px || || Training helicopter || Mi-2 || 41|| |- ! colspan="7" |UAVs |- | Aeronautics Defense Orbiter | 150px | | Small UAV | | 11http://www.samolotypolskie.pl/samoloty/226/126/Aeronautics-Defense- Orbiter2 | Also operated by Polish Special Forces. |- | WB Electronics FlyEye ||UAV FlyEye 09|| || Small UAV || || 12 || |- valign="top" | Boeing Insitu ScanEagle || 150px || || Small UAV || || 10 || |} ==Possible/future/ordered equipment== {| class="wikitable" |- !Model!!Image!!Origin!!Type!!Variant!!Number!!Details |- valign="top" | New Designated Marksman Rifle || || || 7.62mm NATO DMR || || 250 || It is planned to buy in near future around 250 examples of DMR, to replace old SWD. |- valign="top" | Light portable Anti-Tank missile System. Program "Corsair"||150px || || 107mm anti-tank guided missile system || || || Prototype testing scheduled for mid-2015. Serial production to begin in 2017-2018. The system will have three types of warheads weighing about 2.5 kg each: Cumulative, Thermobaric and Explosive. System equipped a thermal sight and guidance module. Cooperation between Bumar Holding and Ukrainian "Luch". |- valign="top" | K2 Black Panther || 150px || || Main battle tank || K2PL || 800+ || An upcoming licensed version of K2 for Polish Armed Forces; scheduled to be manufactured from 2023 in Poland. Replacing T-72 main battle tank.http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/nation/2020/01/113_282115.html |- valign="top" | Light armoured long-range reconnaissance vehicle || || || Light armoured reconnaissance vehicles || || 118 || The vehicles will be used by Polish Armed Forces reconnaissance regiments with capable to transport on C130 Hercules. With a maximum payload of 900kg. Deliveries are expected to commence in 2016-2022. In August 2017, MoD selected Polish vehicle named Wirus IV. |- valign="top" | New Infantry fighting vehicle BWP Borsuk|||| || || || || Developed to replace BWP-1 in land forces. |- valign="top" | New Amphibious Armoured Scout Car Program || || || || || || Probably will be built by AMZ- Kutno. Replacement for BRDM-2 |- valign="top" | KMO Rak || 150px || || 120mm self-propelled mortar || SMG SMK AWD AWRU AWA AWR WZT | 0 122 60 10 24 0 0 | SMG 120 - Rak mortar mounted on tracked chassis.(modernized Opal-I, in future it would be chassis of Polish IFV) SMK 120 - RAK mortar mounted on KTO Rosomak chassis. Built by Huta Stalowa Wola. Company-level Fire Module (KMO) consists of 8 fire units (SMK), 4 command vehicles (AWD), 2 artillery reconnaissance vehicle (AWR), 3 ammunition vehicles (AWA), 1 armament repair shop (AWRU),1 recovery vehicle (WZT) . 8 KMO are delivered. 7 more KMO ordered and additional 2 SMK for Artillery Training Center in Torun. |- valign="top" | DMO Regina ||150px || || 155mm self-propelled howitzer ||Krab WDSZz WD WA WRUiE | 120 10 45 30 5 | Squadron- level Fire Module (DMO) REGINA consist of 24 howitzers, 2 command and control vehicle (WDSz), 9 command vehicles (WD), 6 ammunition vehicles (WA), 1 armament and electronics repair shop (WRUiE), 1 liaison officer vehicle |- valign="top" | AHS Kryl |||| || 155mm self-propelled auto-loading gun || || 168 || New self-propelled auto-loading gun for land forces, built by Huta Stalowa Wola, System uses a license built ATMOS 2000 howitzer. The vehicle platform is a special version Jelcz heavy truck. Prototype completion scheduled for 2015. In future the Kryl will replace 152mm SpGH DANA. |- valign="top" | Baobab-K || || || Minelayer || || || New minelayer system built by Huta Stalowa Wola. |- valign="top" | New Self-Propelled Anti-Aircraft Gun Program "Noteć" || || || Self-propelled anti-aircraft gun || || 20 || |- valign="top" | New low range Surface-to-air missile Program, "Narew" || || || New SAM System || || 11 batteries || Cooperation between Polski Holding Obronny, Warsaw University of Technology and Military University of Technology in Warsaw Missile is in advanced phase of development. |- valign="top" | M142 HIMARS || 150px || || Multiple rocket launcher || || || 20 launchers and support vehicles on order. |- |Bystra |150x150px | |AESA radar | |16 |Bystra is to support SHORAD and VSHORAD air defence elements. 16 radars ordered during the MSPO 2019 exhibition. Deliveries 2019 - 2025. |- valign="top" | New Attack helicopters Program, "Kruk" || || || New attack helicopter || || 32 || 32 are to be bought as replacement for Mi-24. 4 companies are interested in participation in the tender: Bell Helicopters with AH-1Z, Boeing Defense, Space & Security with AH-64E, Agusta Westland with AW-129 Mangusta and Airbus Helicopters with EC-665 Tiger. |- |New Self-propelled anti-aircraft gun Program "Sona" | | |Self-propelled anti-aircraft gun | | |Planned to replace ZSU-23-4 |- |New MBT Program "Wilk" | | |Main battle tank | | |Planned to replace old T-72 and PT-91 |- |New Grenade Launcher Program "Grot" | | |Grenade launcher | | | |- |New Tank Destroyer Program "Ottokar-Brzoza" | | |Tank destroyer | | |Planned to replace 9M14 Malyutka |- |New Medium Range UAV Program "Gryf" | | |Medium range UAV | | | |} ==References== Category:Polish Land Forces Polish Army
title: List of equipment of the Polish Land Forces
